docs.snippet: The European Union's financial markets "coped well" with fallout from Britain's decision last week to leave the bloc, with no extraordinary measures needed by regulators, the EU's top securities watchdog said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Union's financial markets "coped well" with fallout from Britain's decision last week to leave the bloc, with no extraordinary measures needed by regulators, the EU's top securities watchdog said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Market Infrastructure Coped Well With Brexit Fallout-EU Watchdog
headline.print_headline: Market Infrastructure Coped Well With Brexit Fallout-EU Watchdog

docs.snippet: Wall Street bounced back on Tuesday, recouping some recent losses, as investors sought cheap assets after a two-day equities rout sparked by Britain's decision to leave the European Union....

docs.snippet: Several online travel sites have seen a jump in queries from Americans about travel to the United Kingdom since it voted to leave the European Union, a sign so-called "Brexit" and the resulting drop in the value of the pound currency may spur U.S....
docs.lead_paragraph: Several online travel sites have seen a jump in queries from Americans about travel to the United Kingdom since it voted to leave the European Union, a sign so-called "Brexit" and the resulting drop in the value of the pound currency may spur U.S. visits to Britain.

headline.main: U.S. Interest in U.K. Travel Soars After Brexit
headline.print_headline: U.S. Interest in U.K. Travel Soars After Brexit

docs.snippet: There is no time to waste organising Britain's exit from the European Union and its aftermath, French President Francois Hollande said on Monday at a joint news conference with the leaders of Germany and Italy....

docs.snippet: Airlines, holiday companies and housebuilders joined British banks in bearing the brunt of Brexit-induced market turmoil on Monday, which analysts said reflected expectations Britain was headed for recession following its vote to leave the EU....
docs.lead_paragraph: Airlines, holiday companies and housebuilders joined British banks in bearing the brunt of Brexit-induced market turmoil on Monday, which analysts said reflected expectations Britain was headed for recession following its vote to leave the EU.

headline.main: Post-Brexit Slowdown Fears Hit Holiday Firms, Builders and Airlines
headline.print_headline: Post-Brexit Slowdown Fears Hit Holiday Firms, Builders and Airlines

docs.snippet: Scotland's parliament would consider blocking legislation on Britain's exit from the European Union if that were necessary to protect Scottish interests, First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Sunday....

docs.snippet: As Britain's shock decision to leave the party broke on the European Union on Friday, EU ministers met as planned in Luxembourg, where they reacted to the news but quickly moved on to what the bloc does best -- sticking to the routine....

docs.snippet: Britain's decision to leave the European Union strengthens the case for Catalonia to be allowed to seek independence from Spain, the head of the region's government said on Friday....

docs.snippet: The European Union has suffered an "explosive shock" and must reinvent itself to prevent its break-up and restore the confidence of voters, French leaders said on Friday after Britain voted to quit the bloc....

headline.main: France Says New Europe Needed After Brexit 'Explosive Shock'
